2.notes: grace be to you - The word "you" refers to all the believers at Ephesus.

1.quote: I urge you to live a life worthy of the calling
1.notes: I urge you to live a life worthy of the calling - In all these verses the word "you" refers to all the believers at Ephesus. AT: "I encourage with you to conduct yourself in a manner proper of the calling"

3.quote: May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ be praised
3.notes: May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ be praised - This could be worded in the active form. AT: "Let us praise the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ"

14.notes: until the possession is gained - AT: "until we gain possession of our inheritance"

10.quote: there will be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places through the Church the complex wisdom of God
10.notes: there will be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places through the Church the complex wisdom of God - AT: "God will make his complex wisdom known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places through the Church"

7.quote: To each one of us has been given a gift
7.notes: To each one of us has been given a gift - AT: "A gift has been given to each believer" or "God gave a gift to each one of us"

31.quote: Let all bitterness...be taken away from you
31.notes: Let all bitterness...be taken away from you - AT: "Let God take away all feelings of hostility" or "Let God take away all feelings of hatred"

19.quote: that the message might be given to me
19.notes: that the message might be given to me - AT: "that God might give me the word" or "God might give me the message"

3.notes: has blessed us - This is an inclusive pronoun referring to Paul and all the believers at Ephesus.

5.notes: predestined us - Paul was including himself, the Ephesian church and all believers in Christ in his use of "us."

7.notes: we have redemption - "We" refers to all believers.

8.notes: come from us - The pronoun "us" refers to Paul and all the believers at Ephesus.

10.quote: we are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus
10.notes: we are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus - The pronoun "we" refers to Paul and all the believers at Ephesus. AT: "God has created us as new people joined to Christ Jesus"

14.notes: divided us from each other - "Us" refers to both Paul and the Ephesians, that separated the Jewish believers from the Gentile believers.

18.quote: For through Jesus we both have access
18.notes: For through Jesus we both have access - "We both" refers to both Paul, the believing Jews and the believing non-Jews.

20.notes: that we ask or think - "We" includes Paul and his audience.

7.notes: To each one of us - The word "us" includes Paul and all the believers at Ephesus.

25.quote: we are members of each other
25.notes: we are members of each other - AT: "we are all members of God's family"

30.quote: we are members of his body
30.notes: we are members of his body - The word "we" refers to Paul and all the believers.

4.quote: so we could be holy and blameless
4.notes: so we could be holy and blameless - Paul states two traits that we can become in God.

1.notes: your trespasses and your sins - The words "trespasses" and "sins" mean basically the same thing. Paul uses them together to emphasize the greatness of the people's sin.

10.notes: rulers and authorities - These words share similar meanings. Paul uses them together to emphasize that every spiritual being will know God's wisdom.

31.notes: shouting and insults - The word "shouting" intensifies the harshness of "insults." AT: "harsh verbal abuse"

27.notes: holy and without fault - The phrase "without fault" means basically the same thing as "holy." Paul uses the two together to emphasize the Church's purity.

5.notes: deep respect and trembling - These are two similar ways to show honor towards one's master.

11.quote: we were chosen...we who were the first
11.notes: we were chosen...we who were the first - The word "we" now refers to Paul, his Jewish brothers in Christ but not the Gentile (non-Jewish) believers.

12.notes: we who were the first - Paul continues to exclude the Gentiles (non-Jews) from his use of "we."

13.quote: were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit
13.notes: were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit - As wax was placed on a letter and impressed with a symbol representing who sent the letter, God sealed our salvation with the Holy Spirit signifying his ownership of us.

22.quote: the head over all things in the Church
22.notes: the head over all things in the Church - "Head" implies the leader or the one in charge. AT: "ruler over all things in the Church"

23.notes: which is his body - The Church is often referred to as the body of Christ.

1.quote: And you were dead in your trespasses and your sins
1.notes: And you were dead in your trespasses and your sins - This shows how sinful people are unable to obey God in the same way a dead person is unable to respond physically.

5.quote: while we were dead in trespasses, he brought us to new life
5.notes: while we were dead in trespasses, he brought us to new life - This shows how a sinful person is unable to obey God until he is given new spiritual life just like a dead person is unable to respond physically unless he is raised from the dead.

19.quote: you Gentiles are no longer strangers and foreigners, but instead you are fellow citizens with those set apart for God, those who are members of God's family
19.notes: you Gentiles are no longer strangers and foreigners, but instead you are fellow citizens with those set apart for God, those who are members of God's family - This is describing the spiritual condition of Gentiles before and after they became believers in the same way as a non-citizen becomes a citizen of a nation.

20.quote: These are built upon the foundation...
20.notes: These are built upon the foundation... - Paul compares God's family to a building. Christ being the cornerstone, the apostles being the foundation, and the believers being the structure.

21.quote: the whole building of his family fits together and increases as a temple set apart for the Lord
21.notes: the whole building of his family fits together and increases as a temple set apart for the Lord - Paul continues with the comparison of Christ's family to a building in the way a builder fits stones in the making a building so Christ is fitting us together.

22.quote: in whom you also are being built together into a dwelling place for God in the Spirit
22.notes: in whom you also are being built together into a dwelling place for God in the Spirit - This describes how believers are being put together to become a place where God will permanently dwell in the Spirit just as a house is a dwelling place for people on earth.

17.quote: that you be rooted and grounded in his love
17.notes: that you be rooted and grounded in his love - Paul compares their faith like a tree that has deep roots or a house build on a solid foundation. AT: "that you will be like a firmly rooted tree and a building founded upon stone"

4.notes: one body - All believers in the family of God are like the various members of a human body.

12.quote: for the building up of the body of Christ
12.notes: for the building up of the body of Christ - This metaphor compares growing spiritually to doing exercises to increase the strength of the human body.

14.quote: tossed around and carried away by every wind of teaching
14.notes: tossed around and carried away by every wind of teaching - This metaphor compares a believer who has not become mature and hears wrong teaching to a boat that is being blown by the wind in random directions on the water.

15.quote: into him who is the head...in the body's growth
15.notes: into him who is the head...in the body's growth - This is a metaphor using the human body to describe how Christ causes believers to work together in harmony like the head of a body causes the body parts to work together to grow healthy.

16.quote: into him who is the head...in the body's growth
16.notes: into him who is the head...in the body's growth - This is a metaphor using the human body to describe how Christ causes believers to work together in harmony like the head of a body causes the body parts to work together to grow healthy.

22.quote: you must put off the old man
22.notes: you must put off the old man - You must rid yourself of all sinful behavior just like taking off clothes and throwing them away. AT: "you must change your behavior"

24.quote: so that you may put on the new man
24.notes: so that you may put on the new man - This shows how an unbeliever becomes a new person when he becomes a believer by the power of God, just as a person puts on new clothing and looks totally different.

8.quote: but now you are light in the Lord
8.notes: but now you are light in the Lord - Just as one can see in the light, so people who live in righteousness have spiritual understanding.

9.quote: because the fruit of the light is all goodness, righteousness, and truth
9.notes: because the fruit of the light is all goodness, righteousness, and truth - The works coming from the life of a believer (goodness, righteousness, and truth) are like the good fruit produced by a healthy tree.

11.quote: the unfruitful works of the darkness
11.notes: the unfruitful works of the darkness - The works of someone living in spiritual darkness are like the evil actions of people who do evil works hidden by the darkness at night.

13.notes: Christ will shine on you - Christ will enable an unbeliever to understand his provision of forgiveness and new life just as light shows what is actually there that was hidden by darkness.

26.quote: he cleansed us by the washing of water by the word
26.notes: he cleansed us by the washing of water by the word - Possible meanings are 1) Paul is referring to having been made clean by God's word and through water baptism in Christ or 2) Paul is saying God made us spiritually clean from our sins by the word of God like we make our bodies clean by washing with water.

30.quote: we are members of his body
30.notes: we are members of his body - Possible meanings are 1) "we are members of his body of believers" (non-metaphorical sense) or 2) Believers fit together to form the body of Christ just as the parts of the human body fit together to form a person.

11.quote: Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the scheming plans of the devil
11.notes: Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the scheming plans of the devil - Christians should use all the resources God gives to stand firm against the devil just as a soldier puts on armor to protect himself from enemy attacks.

13.quote: Therefore put on the whole armor of God
13.notes: Therefore put on the whole armor of God - Christians should use the protective resources God gives them in fighting the devil in the same way a soldier puts on armor to protect himself against his enemies.

14.notes: the breastplate of righteousness - The gift of righteousness covers a believer's heart just as a breastplate protects the chest of a soldier.

15.quote: wear shoes on your feet that are prepared to proclaim the gospel of peace
15.notes: wear shoes on your feet that are prepared to proclaim the gospel of peace - Just as a soldier wears shoes to give him solid footing, the believer must have solid knowledge of the gospel of peace in order to be ready to proclaim it.

16.quote: the flaming arrows of the evil one
16.notes: the flaming arrows of the evil one - The attacks of the devil against a believer are like flaming arrows shot at a soldier by an enemy.

17.quote: the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God
17.notes: the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God - The word of God, inspired by the Holy Spirit, is to be used to fight against and defend the believer from the devil just as a soldier uses his sword to fight and defend against enemy attacks.

16.quote: I have not stopped thanking God
16.notes: I have not stopped thanking God - This can be translated as a positive statement. AT: "I continue to thank God"

18.quote: that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened
18.notes: that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened - The phrase "eyes of your heart" expresses one's ability to gain understanding. AT: "that you may gain understanding and be enlightened"

20.quote: seated him at his right hand
20.notes: seated him at his right hand - "seated Christ at God's right hand." This is the highest place of honor.

2.notes: you once walked - This expresses the behavior of how people live. AT: "you once lived"

12.notes: flesh and blood - This expression refers to people, in contrast to spirits who do not have human bodies.

22.notes: all things under Christ's feet - This represents Christ's lordship, authority and power. AT: "all things under Christ’s power"

2.quote: according to the age of this world
2.notes: according to the age of this world - The apostles also used “world” to refer to the selfish behaviors and corrupt values of the people living in this world. AT: “according to the values of people living in the world” or “following the principles of this present world”

3.quote: acted according to the evil desires of our flesh, doing the will of the flesh and of the mind
3.notes: acted according to the evil desires of our flesh, doing the will of the flesh and of the mind - The words "flesh" and "mind" are used as metonyms for the entire body.

16.notes: because the days are evil - The word "days" means the times you are living in.

7.quote: For this I became a servant
7.notes: For this I became a servant - AT: "I am now serving God to spread the gospel"

12.notes: access with confidence - AT: "access into God's presence with confidence" or "freedom to enter into God's presence with confidence"

14.notes: For this cause - AT: "Because God has done all this for you"

11.notes: Christ gave gifts like these - AT: "Christ gave gifts to the Church like these"

7.quote: So do not be participants with them
7.notes: So do not be participants with them - AT: "Be sure you do not participate with them in evil behavior"

23.quote: he is the Savior of the body
23.notes: he is the Savior of the body - AT: "Christ is the Savior of the body of believers" or "Christ is the Savior of all believers"

24.quote: so also must wives be to their husbands in everything
24.notes: so also must wives be to their husbands in everything - AT: "so wives must also be subject to their husbands in everything"

28.notes: as their own bodies - AT: "as they love their own bodies"

3.quote: that it may be well with you, and you may live long on the earth
3.notes: that it may be well with you, and you may live long on the earth - The pronoun "you" refers to the children of Israel to whom Moses was speaking. AT: "so that you may prosper and live a long life on the earth"

10.quote: be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might
10.notes: be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might - AT: "depend completely on the Lord to give you spiritual strength"
